poem:
Title: The Muted Cries of Gaza

In this land, ripped wide as a mouth
crying silence to an uncaring sky,
sits Gaza. Its rubble-breath caught
in constant prayer, asking why.

Homes crumble, like dreams in fists,
under an airborne rain of fear.
Hopes lie sodden, soaked in grief,
a quiet testament to disappeared cheer.

Through empty alleys, loss echoes still,
Yet, humanity persists, against the will.
